description: Switch up your dinner with this 25-minute, Sicilian-inspired salmon recipe. Pine nuts give a delicious crunch and the olives pair perfectly with fish.
name: Sicilian Olive, Caper & LemonCrusted Salmon Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 500g frozen Ocean Chef salmon portions, skin on
0.5 cup pitted Sicilian olives, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fanforced. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place salmon, skin-sides down, on tray.
Zest 1 lemon. Combine olives, capers, oil, lemon zest and pine nuts in a bowl. Toss to combine. Spoon olive mixture over salmon. Bake for 6 minutes or until salmon is just cooked through.

Meanwhile, cook beans in a medium saucepan of boiling water for 1 minute or until bright green and just tender. Drain. Heat a medium frying pan over medium heat. Cook butter and garlic for 30 seconds, stirring, or until fragrant. Add beans and toss to coat. Remove pan from heat and toss through half of the basil. Season.
Cut remaining lemon into wedges. Divide salmon and bean mixture among plates. Serve with lemon wedges and remaining basil leaves.
